title: NASA, International Astronauts to Speak with Students in Two States
summary: Students from North Carolina and Rhode Island will have separate opportunities next week to hear from astronauts aboard the International Space Station.

title: BREAKING! FAA Completes SpaceX Starship IFT-1 Investigation, 63 Corrective Actions Required
summary: The FAA has closed the SpaceX Starship Super Heavy mishap investigation.The final report cites multiple root causes of the April 20, 2023, mishap and 63 corrective actions SpaceX must take to prevent mishap reoccurrence.

title: MaiaSpace Complete First Cryogenic Test of Second Stage Prototype
summary:
MaiaSpace has completed the first cryogenic test of a full-scale prototype of the Maia rocket’s second stage. Maia is a partially reusable two-stage launch vehicle being developed by the ArianeGroup subsidiary. The vehicle is designed to be capable of delivering up to 1,500 kilograms to orbit when its first stage is expended and 500 kilograms […]
The post MaiaSpace Complete First Cryogenic Test of Second Stage Prototype appeared first on European Spaceflight.

title: Letter: Grateful for ‘Space Greta’
summary: I was so happy to see SpaceNews recognize several of the many young, talented, hardworking, selfless professionals who are fueling efforts to make space safer for the generations to come in the story "Stand Up, Space Greta." Putting Greta on the cover of SpaceNews was a compelling way to attract the exact people that we need to enlist to enable space sustainability.

title: The future of human spaceflight safety is in the hands of Congress
summary: Congress has a choice to make this fall: reauthorize the “learning period” putting the nation on a glide path to secure a safety framework commensurate with industry maturity, or allow the “learning period” to expire, which puts the future of commercial human spaceflight – and American leadership in space writ large – at serious risk.

title: GAO report calls for more transparency on SLS costs
summary: The Government Accountability Office called on NASA to be more transparent about the costs of the Space Launch System rocket, a vehicle senior agency officials acknowledged risked becoming “unaffordable.”

title: EU and UK reach deal on Copernicus
summary: The European Union and the United Kingdom have reached a deal that will allow the UK to resume participation in the EU elements of the Copernicus Earth observation program.

title: New report recommends Space Force change how it buys commercial satellite services
summary: The U.S. Space Force should overhaul its current approach to procuring commercial satellite communications services, a RAND Corp. report recommends.

title: NASA finally admits what everyone already knows: SLS is unaffordable
summary: "At current cost levels the SLS program is unsustainable."

title: South Africa joins China’s moon base project
summary: South Africa has formally joined the China-led ILRS project to establish a permanent moon base.
